thag17.1:5.4: asked the one known as Phussa:
thag17.1:8.1: In the future many will be
thag17.1:9.1: Imagining they understand the depths of the teaching,
thag17.1:9.2: they remain on the near shore.
thag17.1:9.3: Superficial and disrespectful towards the teaching,
thag17.1:9.4: they lack respect for one another.
thag17.1:10.2: many dangers will arise in the world.
thag17.1:10.4: the Dhamma that was taught so well.
thag17.1:11.2: unlearned prattlers, too sure of themselves,
thag17.1:12.2: the conscientious and unbiased, acting in the proper spirit,
thag17.1:13.1: In the future, fools will accept
thag17.1:13.3: fields and land, goats and sheep,
thag17.1:13.4: and bonded servants, male and female.
thag17.1:14.1: Fools looking for fault in others,
thag17.1:14.2: but unsteady in their own ethics,
thag17.1:15.4: they’ll wander as if they were noble ones.
thag17.1:16.1: With hair sleeked back with oil,
thag17.1:16.2: fickle, their eyes painted with eye-liner,
thag17.1:16.4: wrapped in robes of ivory color.
thag17.1:17.2: worn without disgust by the free,
thag17.1:18.4: they’ll stay in the neighborhood of villages.
thag17.1:19.1: Being unrestrained, they’ll keep company with
thag17.1:19.2: those who get lots of stuff,
thag17.1:19.3: and who always enjoy wrong livelihood,
thag17.1:20.2: who don’t get lots of stuff,
thag17.1:20.3: and they won’t associate with the wise,
thag17.1:21.2: which is dyed the color of copper,
thag17.1:21.3: some will wear the white banner
thag17.1:21.4: of those who follow other paths.
thag17.1:22.4: on the nature of the ocher robe.
thag17.1:24.2: seeing the deep-dyed banner of the perfected ones,
thag17.1:25.2: who will wear the ocher robe
thag17.1:25.4: they are not worthy of the ocher robe.
thag17.1:26.4: they are truly worthy of the ocher robe.
thag17.1:27.4: they are not worthy of the ocher robe.
thag17.1:28.4: they are truly worthy of the ocher robe.
thag17.1:29.2: who has no ethics at all,
thag17.1:29.3: is worthy of a white robe—
thag17.1:29.4: what use is an ocher robe for them?
thag17.1:30.1: In the future, monks and nuns
thag17.1:30.2: with corrupt hearts, lacking regard for others,
thag17.1:31.1: Though trained in wearing the robe
thag17.1:32.1: With that kind of attitude to training,
thag17.1:32.2: those fools won’t respect each other,
thag17.1:32.3: or take any notice of their mentors,
thag17.1:32.4: like a wild colt with its charioteer.
thag17.1:33.4: when the latter days have come.
thag17.1:35.1: Have hearts of love and compassion,
thag17.1:35.2: and please do keep your precepts.
